00027 namespace GeographicLib {

00029   class MagneticCircle;
00030 
00031   /**
00032    * \brief Model of the earth's magnetic field
00033    *
00034    * Evaluate the earth's magnetic field according to a model.  At present only
00035    * internal magnetic fields are handled.  These are due to the earth's code
00036    * and crust; these vary slowly (over many years).  Excluded are the effects
00037    * of currents in the ionosphere and magnetosphere which have daily and
00038    * annual variations.
00039    *
00040    * See \ref magnetic for details of how to install the magnetic model and the
00041    * data format.
00042    *
00043    * See
00044    * - General information:
00045    *   - http://geomag.org/models/index.html
00046    * - WMM2010:
00047    *   - http://ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/WMM/DoDWMM.shtml
00048    *   - http://ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/WMM/data/WMM2010/WMM2010COF.zip
00049    * - IGRF11:
00050    *   - http://ngdc.noaa.gov/IAGA/vmod/igrf.html
00051    *   - http://ngdc.noaa.gov/IAGA/vmod/igrf11coeffs.txt
00052    *   - http://ngdc.noaa.gov/IAGA/vmod/geomag70_linux.tar.gz
00053    * - EMM2010:
00054    *   - http://ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/EMM/index.html
00055    *   - http://ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/EMM/data/geomag/EMM2010_Sph_Windows_Linux.zip
00056    *
00057    * Example of use:
00058    * \include example-MagneticModel.cpp
00059    **********************************************************************/
00060 
00061   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT MagneticModel {
00062   private:
00063     typedef Math::real real;
00064     static const int idlength_ = 8;
00065     std::string _name, _dir, _description, _date, _filename, _id;
00066     real _t0, _dt0, _tmin, _tmax, _a, _hmin, _hmax;
00067     int _Nmodels;
00068     SphericalHarmonic::normalization _norm;
00069     Geocentric _earth;
00070     std::vector< std::vector<real> > _G;
00071     std::vector< std::vector<real> > _H;
00072     std::vector<SphericalHarmonic> _harm;
00073     void Field(real t, real lat, real lon, real h, bool diffp,
00074                real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz,
00075                real& Bxt, real& Byt, real& Bzt) const throw();
00076     void ReadMetadata(const std::string& name);
00077     MagneticModel(const MagneticModel&); // copy constructor not allowed
00078     MagneticModel& operator=(const MagneticModel&); // nor copy assignment
00079   public:
00080 
00081     /** \name Setting up the magnetic model
00082      **********************************************************************/
00083     ///@{
00084     /**
00085      * Construct a magnetic model.
00086      *
00087      * @param[in] name the name of the model.
00088      * @param[in] path (optional) directory for data file.
00089      * @param[in] earth (optional) Geocentric object for converting
00090      *   coordinates; default Geocentric::WGS84.
00091      *
00092      * A filename is formed by appending ".wmm" (World Magnetic Model) to the
00093      * name.  If \e path is specified (and is non-empty), then the file is
00094      * loaded from directory, \e path.  Otherwise the path is given by the
00095      * DefaultMagneticPath().  This may throw an exception because the file
00096      * does not exist, is unreadable, or is corrupt.
00097      *
00098      * This file contains the metadata which specifies the properties of the
00099      * model.  The coefficients for the spherical harmonic sums are obtained
00100      * from a file obtained by appending ".cof" to metadata file (so the
00101      * filename ends in ".wwm.cof").
00102      *
00103      * The model is not tied to a particular ellipsoidal model of the earth.
00104      * The final earth argument to the constructor specify an ellipsoid to
00105      * allow geodetic coordinates to the transformed into the spherical
00106      * coordinates used in the spherical harmonic sum.
00107      **********************************************************************/
00108     explicit MagneticModel(const std::string& name,
00109                            const std::string& path = "",
00110                            const Geocentric& earth = Geocentric::WGS84);
00111     ///@}
00112 
00113     /** \name Compute the magnetic field
00114      **********************************************************************/
00115     ///@{
00116     /**
00117      * Evaluate the components of the geomagnetic field.
00118      *
00119      * @param[in] t the time (years).
00120      * @param[in] lat latitude of the point (degrees).
00121      * @param[in] lon longitude of the point (degrees).
00122      * @param[in] h the height of the point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00123      * @param[out] Bx the easterly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00124      * @param[out] By the northerly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00125      * @param[out] Bz the vertical (up) component of the magnetic field
00126      *   (nanotesla).
00127      **********************************************************************/
00128     void operator()(real t, real lat, real lon, real h,
00129                     real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz) const throw() {
00130       real dummy;
00131       Field(t, lat, lon, h, false, Bx, By, Bz, dummy, dummy, dummy);
00132     }
00133 
00134     /**
00135      * Evaluate the components of the geomagnetic field and their time
00136      * derivatives
00137      *
00138      * @param[in] t the time (years).
00139      * @param[in] lat latitude of the point (degrees).
00140      * @param[in] lon longitude of the point (degrees).
00141      * @param[in] h the height of the point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00142      * @param[out] Bx the easterly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00143      * @param[out] By the northerly component of the magnetic field (nanotesla).
00144      * @param[out] Bz the vertical (up) component of the magnetic field
00145      *   (nanotesla).
00146      * @param[out] Bxt the rate of change of \e Bx (nT/yr).
00147      * @param[out] Byt the rate of change of \e By (nT/yr).
00148      * @param[out] Bzt the rate of change of \e Bz (nT/yr).
00149      **********************************************************************/
00150     void operator()(real t, real lat, real lon, real h,
00151                     real& Bx, real& By, real& Bz,
00152                     real& Bxt, real& Byt, real& Bzt) const throw() {
00153       Field(t, lat, lon, h, true, Bx, By, Bz, Bxt, Byt, Bzt);
00154     }
00155 
00156     /**
00157      * Create a MagneticCircle object to allow the geomagnetic field at many
00158      * points with constant \e lat, \e h, and \e t and varying \e lon to be
00159      * computed efficiently.
00160      *
00161      * @param[in] t the time (years).
00162      * @param[in] lat latitude of the point (degrees).
00163      * @param[in] h the height of the point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00164      * @return a MagneticCircle object whose MagneticCircle::operator()(real
00165      *   lon) member function computes the field at particular values of \e
00166      *   lon.
00167      *
00168      * If the field at several points on a circle of latitude need to be
00169      * calculated then creating a MagneticCircle and using its member functions
00170      * will be substantially faster, especially for high-degree models.
00171      **********************************************************************/
00172     MagneticCircle Circle(real t, real lat, real h) const;
00173 
00174     /**
00175      * Compute various quantities dependent on the magnetic field.
00176      *
00177      * @param[in] Bx the \e x (easterly) component of the magnetic field (nT).
00178      * @param[in] By the \e y (northerly) component of the magnetic field (nT).
00179      * @param[in] Bz the \e z (vertical, up positive) component of the magnetic
00180      *   field (nT).
00181      * @param[out] H the horizontal magnetic field (nT).
00182      * @param[out] F the total magnetic field (nT).
00183      * @param[out] D the declination of the field (degrees east of north).
00184      * @param[out] I the inclination of the field (degrees down from
00185      *   horizontal).
00186      **********************************************************************/
00187     static void FieldComponents(real Bx, real By, real Bz,
00188                                 real& H, real& F, real& D, real& I) throw() {
00189       real Ht, Ft, Dt, It;
00190       FieldComponents(Bx, By, Bz, real(0), real(1), real(0),
00191                       H, F, D, I, Ht, Ft, Dt, It);
00192     }
00193 
00194     /**
00195      * Compute various quantities dependent on the magnetic field and its rate
00196      * of change.
00197      *
00198      * @param[in] Bx the \e x (easterly) component of the magnetic field (nT).
00199      * @param[in] By the \e y (northerly) component of the magnetic field (nT).
00200      * @param[in] Bz the \e z (vertical, up positive) component of the magnetic
00201      *   field (nT).
00202      * @param[in] Bxt the rate of change of \e Bx (nT/yr).
00203      * @param[in] Byt the rate of change of \e By (nT/yr).
00204      * @param[in] Bzt the rate of change of \e Bz (nT/yr).
00205      * @param[out] H the horizontal magnetic field (nT).
00206      * @param[out] F the total magnetic field (nT).
00207      * @param[out] D the declination of the field (degrees east of north).
00208      * @param[out] I the inclination of the field (degrees down from
00209      *   horizontal).
00210      * @param[out] Ht the rate of change of \e H (nT/yr).
00211      * @param[out] Ft the rate of change of \e F (nT/yr).
00212      * @param[out] Dt the rate of change of \e D (degrees/yr).
00213      * @param[out] It the rate of change of \e I (degrees/yr).
00214      **********************************************************************/
00215     static void FieldComponents(real Bx, real By, real Bz,
00216                                 real Bxt, real Byt, real Bzt,
00217                                 real& H, real& F, real& D, real& I,
00218                                 real& Ht, real& Ft, real& Dt, real& It) throw();
00219     ///@}
00220 
00221     /** \name Inspector functions
00222      **********************************************************************/
00223     ///@{
00224     /**
00225      * @return the description of the magnetic model, if available, from the
00226      *   Description file in the data file; if absent, return "NONE".
00227      **********************************************************************/
00228     const std::string& Description() const throw() { return _description; }
00229 
00230     /**
00231      * @return date of the model, if available, from the ReleaseDate field in
00232      *   the data file; if absent, return "UNKNOWN".
00233      **********************************************************************/
00234     const std::string& DateTime() const throw() { return _date; }
00235 
00236     /**
00237      * @return full file name used to load the magnetic model.
00238      **********************************************************************/
00239     const std::string& MagneticFile() const throw() { return _filename; }
00240 
00241     /**
00242      * @return "name" used to load the magnetic model (from the first argument
00243      *   of the constructor, but this may be overridden by the model file).
00244      **********************************************************************/
00245     const std::string& MagneticModelName() const throw() { return _name; }
00246 
00247     /**
00248      * @return directory used to load the magnetic model.
00249      **********************************************************************/
00250     const std::string& MagneticModelDirectory() const throw() { return _dir; }
00251 
00252     /**
00253      * @return the minimum height above the ellipsoid (in meters) for which
00254      *   this MagneticModel should be used.
00255      *
00256      * Because the model will typically provide useful results
00257      * slightly outside the range of allowed heights, no check of \e t
00258      * argument is made by MagneticModel::operator()() or
00259      * MagneticModel::Circle.
00260      **********************************************************************/
00261     Math::real MinHeight() const throw() { return _hmin; }
00262 
00263     /**
00264      * @return the maximum height above the ellipsoid (in meters) for which
00265      *   this MagneticModel should be used.
00266      *
00267      * Because the model will typically provide useful results
00268      * slightly outside the range of allowed heights, no check of \e t
00269      * argument is made by MagneticModel::operator()() or
00270      * MagneticModel::Circle.
00271      **********************************************************************/
00272     Math::real MaxHeight() const throw() { return _hmax; }
00273 
00274     /**
00275      * @return the minimum time (in years) for which this MagneticModel should
00276      *   be used.
00277      *
00278      * Because the model will typically provide useful results
00279      * slightly outside the range of allowed times, no check of \e t
00280      * argument is made by MagneticModel::operator()() or
00281      * MagneticModel::Circle.
00282      **********************************************************************/
00283     Math::real MinTime() const throw() { return _tmin; }
00284 
00285     /**
00286      * @return the maximum time (in years) for which this MagneticModel should
00287      *   be used.
00288      *
00289      * Because the model will typically provide useful results
00290      * slightly outside the range of allowed times, no check of \e t
00291      * argument is made by MagneticModel::operator()() or
00292      * MagneticModel::Circle.
00293      **********************************************************************/
00294     Math::real MaxTime() const throw() { return _tmax; }
00295 
00296     /**
00297      * @return \e a the equatorial radius of the ellipsoid (meters).  This is
00298      *   the value of \e a inherited from the Geocentric object used in the
00299      *   constructor.
00300      **********************************************************************/
00301     Math::real MajorRadius() const throw() { return _earth.MajorRadius(); }
00302 
00303     /**
00304      * @return \e f the flattening of the ellipsoid.  This is the value
00305      *   inherited from the Geocentric object used in the constructor.
00306      **********************************************************************/
00307     Math::real Flattening() const throw() { return _earth.Flattening(); }
00308     ///@}
00309 
00310     /**
00311      * @return the default path for magnetic model data files.
00312      *
00313      * This is the value of the environment variable MAGNETIC_PATH, if set;
00314      * otherwise, it is $GEOGRAPHICLIB_DATA/magnetic if the environment
00315      * variable GEOGRAPHICLIB_DATA is set; otherwise, it is a compile-time
00316      * default (/usr/local/share/GeographicLib/magnetic on non-Windows systems
00317      * and C:/Documents and Settings/All Users/Application
00318      * Data/GeographicLib/magnetic on Windows systems).
00319      **********************************************************************/
00320     static std::string DefaultMagneticPath();
00321 
00322     /**
00323      * @return the default name for the magnetic model.
00324      *
00325      * This is the value of the environment variable MAGNETIC_NAME, if set,
00326      * otherwise, it is "wmm2010".  The MagneticModel class does not use this
00327      * function; it is just provided as a convenience for a calling program
00328      * when constructing a MagneticModel object.
00329      **********************************************************************/
00330     static std::string DefaultMagneticName();
00331   };
